title: How to Use a Chopper in GTA Online

steps.title: Board a chopper.
steps.content: Board a chopper. Helicopters can be found on airports, hospitals, and building helipads all around the city. Once you see one, approach it and press the triangle button on your controller to get in.

steps.title: Take off.
steps.content: Take off. To lift off from the ground, press and hold the R2 button on the top of the controller. Keep pressing this button until you reach your desired altitude.

steps.title: Steer.
steps.content: Steer. While in midair (and while still pressing the R2 button), use the left analog stick to go forward or backward, left or right, towards the direction where you want to go.

steps.title: Make sharp turns.
steps.content: Make sharp turns. If you want to make a sudden left or right turn, press the L1 or R1 buttons respectively, and your chopper will make a sharp corner turn.

steps.title: Shoot weapons.
steps.content: Shoot weapons. If the helicopter you’re flying has built-in weapons (such as military helicopters), you can shoot missiles or fire guns by pressing the X button.

steps.title: Change camera views.
steps.content: Change camera views. While flying, you can switch from first, second, or third camera views by pressing the right analog stick.

steps.title: Land.
steps.content: Land. Once you’ve arrived at your destination, press and hold the L2 button to slowly descend. Use the left analog stick while the chopper is descending to help you steer to your desired landing spot.

steps.title: Get in a Helicopter.
steps.content: Get in a Helicopter. Choppers can be found all around the city—on airports, hospitals, and building helipads. When you find a chopping, approach it and press the Y button on your Xbox 360 controller. This will have your character board the chopper.

steps.title: Take off.
steps.content: Take off. To lift off from the ground, press and hold the Right Trigger (LT) button on the topside of the controller to take off. Keep pressing this button until you reach your desired altitude.

steps.title: Steer.
steps.content: Steer. While in midair (and while still pressing the Right Trigger [LT] button), use the left analog stick to go forward or backward, left or right, towards the direction where you want to go.

steps.title: Make sharp turns.
steps.content: Make sharp turns. If you want to make a sudden left or right turn, press the Left Bumper (LB) or Right Bumper (RB) buttons respectively, and your chopper will make a sharp corner turn.

steps.title: Shoot weapons.
steps.content: Shoot weapons. If the helicopter you’re flying has built-in weapons (such as military helicopters), you can shoot missiles or fire guns by pressing the A button.

steps.title: Change camera views.
steps.content: Change camera views. To switch between the first, second, or third camera views while in midair, simply press the right analog stick.

steps.title: Land.
steps.content: Land. Once you’ve arrived at your destination, press and hold the Left Trigger (LT) button to slowly descend. Use the left analog stick while the chopper is descending to help you steer to your desired landing spot.
